gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 8,5]]When Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion approached him and appealed to him,
[[Mt 8,6]]saying, "Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, suffering dreadfully."
[[Mt 8,7]]He said to him, "I will come and cure him."
[[Mt 8,8]]The centurion said in reply, "Lord, I am not worthy to have you enter under my roof; only say the word and my servant will be healed.
[[Mt 8,9]]For I too am a person subject to authority, with soldiers subject to me. And I say to one, 'Go,' and he goes; and to another, 'Come here,' and he comes; and to my slave, 'Do this,' and he does it."
[[Mt 8,10]]When Jesus heard this, he was amazed and said to those following him, "Amen, I say to you, in no one in Israel have I found such faith.
[[Mt 8,11]]I say to you, many will come from the east and the west, and will recline with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob at the banquet in the kingdom of heaven."
[[Mt 8,12]]but the children of the kingdom will be driven out into the outer darkness, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth."
[[Mt 8,13]]And Jesus said to the centurion, "You may go; as you have believed, let it be done for you." And at that very hour (his) servant was healed.
[[Mt 8,14]]Jesus entered the house of Peter, and saw his mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever.
[[Mt 8,15]]He touched her hand, the fever left her, and she rose and waited on him.
[[Mt 8,16]]When it was evening, they brought him many who were possessed by demons, and he drove out the spirits by a word and cured all the sick,
[[Mt 8,17]]to fulfill what had been said by Isaiah the prophet: "He took away our infirmities and bore our diseases."

first_reading.title: Book of Lamentations
first_reading.text:
[[Lm 2,2]]The Lord has consumed without pity all the dwellings of Jacob; He has torn down in his anger the fortresses of daughter Judah; He has brought to the ground in dishonor her king and her princes.
[[Lm 2,10]]On the ground in silence sit the old men of daughter Zion; They strew dust on their heads and gird themselves with sackcloth; The maidens of Jerusalem bow their heads to the ground.
[[Lm 2,11]]Worn out from weeping are my eyes, within me all is in ferment; My gall is poured out on the ground because of the downfall of the daughter of my people, As child and infant faint away in the open spaces of the town.
[[Lm 2,12]]They ask their mothers, "Where is the grain?"--in vain, As they faint away like the wounded in the streets of the city, And breathe their last in their mothers' arms.
[[Lm 2,13]]To what can I liken or compare you, O daughter Jerusalem? What example can I show you for your comfort, virgin daughter Zion? For great as the sea is your downfall; who can heal you?
[[Lm 2,14]]Your prophets had for you false and specious visions; They did not lay bare your guilt, to avert your fate; They beheld for you in vision false and misleading portents.
[[Lm 2,18]]Cry out to the Lord; moan, O daughter Zion! Let your tears flow like a torrent day and night; Let there be no respite for you, no repose for your eyes.
[[Lm 2,19]]Rise up, shrill in the night, at the beginning of every watch; Pour out your heart like water in the presence of the Lord; Lift up your hands to him for the lives of your little ones (Who faint from hunger at the corner of every street).

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 74,1]]Why, O God, have you cast us off forever? 
Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?
[[Ps 74,2]]Remember your flock which you built up of old, 
The tribe you redeemed as your inheritance, 
Mount Zion, where you took up your abode.

[[Ps 74,3]]Turn your steps toward the utter ruins; 
Toward all the damage the enemy has done in the sanctuary.
[[Ps 74,4]]Your foes roar triumphantly in your shrine; 
They have set up their tokens of victory.
[[Ps 74,5a]]They are like men coming up with axes
[[Ps 74,5b]]to a clump of trees.

[[Ps 74,6]]With chisel and hammer they hack at all the paneling of the sanctuary.
[[Ps 74,7]]They set your sanctuary on fire; 
The place where your name abides they have razed and profaned.

[[Ps 74,20]]Look to your covenant, 
For the hiding places in the land and the plains are full of violence.
[[Ps 74,21]]May the humble not retire in confusion; 
May the afflicted and the poor praise your name.
